The increase in the turbine fouling fault index results in increased turbine non-dimensional flow capacity. If it is assumed that the maximum to minimum cycle, temperature ratio T₃/T₁, remains constant, then from the flow compatibility equation (Equation 8.1) the compressor pressure ratio, P₂/P₁, decreases. This is because the compressor non-dimensional flow remains essentially constant due to the steepness of the compressor non-dimensional speed lines.

Since the engine is on an EGT limit, any decrease in the compressor pressure ratio, and therefore in the turbine pressure ratio, causes the turbine entry temperature to decrease, which requires a further reduction in the compressor pressure ratio to maintain the flow compatibility between the compressor and the turbine.
